description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73) to vary condition 6 (Restriction to retail use non-food) of planning permission ref: 33877/ 1 (96/0999) dated 23/08/1996 for 'erection of non-food retail unit (floorspace 2963m squared) with access and parking provision; amendment seeks to allow the sale of class A1 convenience goods, including food retail
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of planning permission ref. 96/0999 (23 August 1996)
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out only in accordance with the submitted plans Site Layout Plan 3587/111 E and Site Location Plan.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| The materials used for the external surfaces of the development shall be in accordance with the details approved pursuant to permission 96/0999.
Reason: To ensure the materials harmonise with the surroundings.
| The hard and soft landscaping for the scheme shall be in accordance shall be in accordance with the landscaping details approved pursuant to permission 96/0999.
Reason: To ensure the development is landscaped to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority in the interests of the visual amenity of the area.
| The screen walls and fences for the scheme shall be in accordance shall be in accordance with the landscaping details approved pursuant to permission 96/0999.
Reason: In the interests of the visual amenity of the area and to restrict access to approved points

| The premises shall be used for food and non-food retail Class A1 and for no other purpose including any other use within Class A1 of the Schedule to the Town & Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 or in any provision equivalent to the Class in any Statutory Instrument revoking or re-enacting that Order with or without modification, without the prior permission in writing of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, in the intrerests of the vitality and viability of established retail centres.

| The car parking and cycle parking spaces indicated on the approved plans shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development and those spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose without the prior permission in writing of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that suitable access and servicing space is available within the site in the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of highway safety in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan 2016 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan.

| A total of five disabled parking spaces shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development and those spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose without the prior permission in writing of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that suitable access and servicing space is available within the site in the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of highway safety in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan 2016 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan.

| The areas shown on the approved plans as parking, access, loading, unloading and manoeuvring areas shall be kept clear and used for these purposes only to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority and shall not be used for any other purpose.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision within the site, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan and policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2016.
| Lighting to the car park area shall be in accordance shall be in accordance with the lighting details approved pursuant to permission 96/0999.
Reason: In the interests of amenity and the safe operation of the car park areas.
| Trolley stores within and adjacent to the car park area shall be in accordance shall be in accordance with the lighting details approved pursuant to permission 96/0999.
Reason: In the interests of amenity and the safe operation of the car park areas.
| Not more than 2,035 sq m of gross external floorspace shall be provided within the site without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To accord with submitted application and to ensure that adequate car parking provision is retained.

| The landscaping and planting on the Council-owned land to the north and west of the site shall be in accordance with the details approved pursuant to permission 96/0999 and shall be maintained as such.
Reason: In the interests of amenity.

| The provision of 1 rapid active vehicle charging point to cover two car parking spaces shall be made prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, and these car parking spaces within the application site shall be kept continuously available for the charging of electric vehicles and shall not be used for any other purpose.

Reason: In the interests of highway/pedestrian safety  and an appropriate operation of the development in accordance with policies 1.1(e) (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A  of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.11, 6.12 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| A detailed Green Travel Plan designed to manage the transport needs of the occupiers of the development, including measures to minimise car usage, promote alternative modes of transport, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority before the first occupation of the development, and the approved green travel plan shall be implemented and complied with the approved document.

Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport to safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interest of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2015 and policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026.

| Prior to occupation of the development pedestrian and cycle visibility splays should be provided measuring 2m by 2m, with no obstruction more than 0.6m high for the existing vehicle access where it meets the back edge of the cycleway and footway.

Reason: In the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of highway safety in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan 2016 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan.
